tool.name: Retrieve Ensembl features in BED format

param.name: extended_bed
param.label: Keep extra columns from ensembl BED

param.name: ucsc_chrom_names
param.label: Use the UCSC names for Chromosomes

param.name: biotypes
param.label: Restrict Feature retrieval to these biotypes

param.name: regions
param.label: Restrict Feature retrieval to comma-separated list of regions
param.help: Each region is specifed as: chr or chr:pos or chr:from-to

tool.help:
Retrieve Ensembl cDNAs in BED format
usage: retrieve_ensembl_bed.py [-h] [-s SPECIES] [-R REGIONS] [-B BIOTYPES] [-X] [-U] [-t] [-v] [-d] output
positional arguments: output Output BED filepath, or for stdout: "-"
optional arguments: -h, --help show this help message and exit -s SPECIES, --species SPECIES Ensembl Species to retrieve -R REGIONS, --regions REGIONS Restrict Ensembl retrieval to regions e.g.: X,2:20000-25000,3:100-500+ -B BIOTYPES, --biotypes BIOTYPES Restrict Ensembl biotypes to retrieve -X, --extended_bed Include the extended columns returned from Ensembl -U, --ucsc_chrom_names Use the UCSC names for Chromosomes -t, --toplevel Print Ensembl toplevel for species -v, --verbose Verbose -d, --debug Debug
Ensembl REST API returns an extended BED format with these additional columns::
second_name, cds_start_status, cds_end_status, exon_frames, type, gene_name, second_gene_name, gene_type
